title: Salmon en Papillote with Lemon
description: Tender salmon fillets baked in parchment with bright lemon, aromatic herbs and crisp vegetables — steamed in their own juices for a delicate, flavorful finish. Quick to prepare, light and low in fat, this method locks in moisture and makes elegant individual servings.

ingredients.display_name: lemon, thinly sliced + extra for serving
ingredients.notes: use half sliced for parcels and half for serving
trim woody ends, cut into 6–8 cm pieces

ingredients.display_name: unsalted butter, cut into small pats
ingredients.notes: adds richness; omit or use olive oil for dairy-free

ingredients.display_name: parchment paper, cut into large squares
ingredients.notes: about 30 x 30 cm (12 x 12 in) each

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F). Prepare two large squares of parchment paper on a work surface and fold each in half, then open to create a center crease for assembly.
Pat salmon fillets dry and season both sides lightly with salt and pepper. Toss vegetables with a small pinch of salt, a little olive oil, and half the minced garlic.
Arrange a bed of sliced shallot, carrots and asparagus on one half of each parchment square, leaving room in the center for the salmon. Place a salmon fillet on top of the vegetables.

Top each fillet with lemon slices, remaining garlic, chopped dill, thyme leaves and a few small pats of butter (or an extra drizzle of olive oil). Add a splash of white wine or broth to each packet to generate steam.
Fold the parchment over the salmon and beginning at one end, crimp the edges tightly by making small overlapping folds to seal the packet. Ensure a tight seal so steam cannot escape.

Place the sealed packets on a baking sheet and transfer to the preheated oven. Bake until the salmon is opaque and flakes easily with a fork (internal temperature about 52–57°C / 125–135°F), about 12–14 minutes depending on thickness.
Remove from oven and let packets rest for 2 minutes. Carefully open the packets away from your face to avoid steam. Serve salmon in parchment on plates, garnished with extra lemon and fresh dill.
